title: Rob Font finally gets a fight, meets Ricky Simon at UFC on ESPN 7
text:
UFC on ESPN 7 just got a little bit deeper

A bantamweight bout between contenders Rob Font (13-6 MMA, 5-4 UFC) and Ricky Simon (15-2 MMA, 3-1 UFC) has been added to the card, which takes place Dec. 7 at Capital One Arena in Washington D.C. The main card airs on ESPN after prelims on ESPN+.

A person with knowledge of the situation confirmed the booking to MMA Junkie after a report from the Washington Post, but asked to remain anonymous as the fight has yet to be officially announced.

Font has been healthy and looking for a fight since early 2019. After both Cody Stamann and John Linker withdrew from their respective bookings with Font in June, the Team Lauzon product was pulled from UFC on ESPN+ 12.

A Massachusetts native, Font seemed like a shoe-in for UFC on ESPN 6 in Boston earlier this month. After a proposed matchup against Jimmie Rivera fizzled out, Font had to watch the event from outside of the cage.

His opponent, Simon, most recently competed at UFC on ESPN+ 13 in July. Simon was upset by returning Hall of Famer Urijah Faber. “The California Kid” finished the fight with strikes just 46 seconds into the first round.

description: A bantamweight bout between contenders Rob Font and Ricky Simon has been added to UFC on ESPN 7.
